what: Download a file from a GitHub repository — download_file
title: Download a file from a GitHub repository — download_file
text: function downloads file specified GitHub repository saves local directory.

title: Download a file from a GitHub repository — download_file
Download a file from a GitHub repository — download_file
text: file_path character string specifying path file GitHub repository. dest_path character string specifying destination directory file saved. verbose logical value indicating whether print messages download process. Default `FALSE`.

title: Download a file from a GitHub repository — download_file
text: character string representing path downloaded file, `NULL` download fails.

what: Get a list of files matching a pattern from a GitHub repository — get_files
title: Get a list of files matching a pattern from a GitHub repository — get_files
text: function retrieves list files specified GitHub repository match given pattern.

title: Get a list of files matching a pattern from a GitHub repository — get_files
Get a list of files matching a pattern from a GitHub repository — get_files
text: pattern character string specifying pattern match file names. dir character string specifying directory GitHub repository search. Default `"data-clean/"`.

title: Get a list of files matching a pattern from a GitHub repository — get_files
text: character vector file paths match pattern, error directory listing fails.

what: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: function downloads files matching specified pattern GitHub repository, loads data frame, optionally deletes temporary directory used downloading.

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
code: load_obtn_data(   pattern,   dest_path = "temp/",   verbose = FALSE,   delete_temp_dir = TRUE )

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: pattern character string specifying pattern match file names. dest_path character string specifying destination directory downloaded files. Default `"temp/"`. verbose logical value indicating whether print messages download process. Default `FALSE`. delete_temp_dir logical value indicating whether delete temporary directory loading data. Default `TRUE`.

title: Load data from a GitHub repository — load_obtn_data
text: data frame containing combined data matching files.

title: Comma formatting — tfff-comma
text: functions create comma labels. mostly just wrappers around scales::comma(), scales::label_comma() ggplot2::scale_(x|y)_continuous(). extra convenience built scale functions already use comma formatting.

title: Comma formatting — tfff-comma
text: accuracy Accuracy labels (e.g. 0.1 0.01) ... arguments passed `scales::comma()`, `scales::label_comma()` `ggplot2::scale_(x|y)_continuous` values Values formatted

title: Comma formatting — tfff-comma
text: character vector comma labels ggplot2 scale.

title: Dollar formatting — tfff-dollar
text: functions format numbers like dollar amounts. mostly wrapper around scales::label_dollar, scales::dollar, ggplot2::scale_*_continuous. major diference two arguments `values` `reference_values`. latter value can used make sure dollar formatting happens based values just values wrt. one county.

title: Dollar formatting — tfff-dollar
code: tfff_label_dollar(values, reference_values = values, uses_suffix = TRUE)  tfff_dollar(values, reference_values = values, uses_suffix = TRUE)  tfff_scale_x_dollar(uses_suffix = FALSE, ...)  tfff_scale_y_dollar(uses_suffix = FALSE, ...)

title: Dollar formatting — tfff-dollar
text: values Vector numbers reference_values Overarching values (e.g. values category just one county.) ... arguments passed `ggplot2::scale_(x|y)_continuous` use_suffix dollar amounts larger 10000 abbreviated 10K? Defaults TRUE non-scale functions FALSE otherwise.

title: Dollar formatting — tfff-dollar
text: character vector dollar amounts ggplot2 scale.

title: Percent formatting — tfff-percent
text: functions create percent labels. mostly just wrappers around scales::percent(), scales::label_percent() ggplot2::scale_(x|y)_continuous(). extra convenience built scale functions already use percent formatting breaks capped 100

title: Percent formatting — tfff-percent
text: accuracy Accuracy percent labels (e.g. 0.1 0.01) ... arguments passed `scales::percent()`, `scales::label_percent()` `ggplot2::scale_(x|y)_continuous` values Values formatted

title: Percent formatting — tfff-percent
text: character vector percent labels ggplot2 scale.
